entry.title: Accountability after ethnic cleansing: University Network for Human Rights and Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Accountability after ethnic cleansing: University Network for Human Rights and Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
‚ÄúWhat happened in Nagorno-Karabakh is one of the most egregious examples of rights abuses that I have seen. And what‚Äôs unique about this is that it‚Äôs gone virtually under the radar for the international community. I‚Äôve never seen such extreme rights abuses that just happen without any sort of real international response.‚Äù
That‚Äôs according to Thomas Becker, legal and policy director at the U.S.-based University Network for Human Rights, who sits down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to review his organization‚Äôs fact-finding, documentation, and advocacy work in Armenia and Nagorno-Karabakh. Becker discusses why the international community has been so silent about Azerbaijan‚Äôs ethnic cleansing of Nagorno-Karabakh‚Äôs Armenians ‚Äî and what can be done about it.
0:00 Fact-finding in Karabakh and Armenia 2:20 What makes Karabakh‚Äôs ethnic cleansing different? 4:35 Why the silence from the international community? 9:36 Was the international community complicit? 11:47 What‚Äôs next for the University Network for Human Rights?

media:group.media:description:
üìç The government will set up a free economic zone around a new ski resort in Armenia‚Äôs western Aragatsotn region, which will provide generous tax breaks to businesses registered there. Authorities say the initiative is needed to boost tourism and create jobs. üìç The head of Armenia‚Äôs biggest business association decried a new government proposal to toughen penalties for tax evasion, saying it will deter investors from the country.

entry.title: Yerevan selects wealthy businessman as envoy to Moscow

media:group.media:title: Yerevan selects wealthy businessman as envoy to Moscow
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia appointed Gurgen Arsenyan, a wealthy businessperson and prominent pro-government lawmaker, as Armenia‚Äôs next ambassador to Russia. üìç Armenia confirmed the existence of a secret memorandum with the Kremlin that paved the way for Yerevan to hand over a critical highway to Baku after the 2020 war. üìç Armenia said it will not agree to dissolve the Minsk Group, an inactive body tasked with mediating a solution to the conflict with Azerbaijan, before signing a normalization deal. üìç Forcibly displaced, Artsakh Armenians work to preserve their dialect in exile: https://shorturl.at/NWIDM üìç Insights with Eric Hacopian: https://youtu.be/JUliWir2EHA

entry.title: India‚Äôs ambassador highlights ‚Äòcapacity building‚Äô amid deepening defense ties with Armenia

media:group.media:title: India‚Äôs ambassador highlights ‚Äòcapacity building‚Äô amid deepening defense ties with Armenia
media:group.media:description:
This week, India‚Äôs Embassy in Yerevan observed Partition Horrors Remembrance Day, marking the British Empire‚Äôs 1947 division of India and Pakistan. The next day, it celebrated Independence Day. CivilNet visited the Indian Embassy and spoke with Ambassador Nilakshi Saha Sinha about the growing ties between Yerevan and New Delhi, especially in defense.

entry.title: What does Erdoƒüan and Aliyev‚Äôs war of words mean for Armenia?

media:group.media:title: What does Erdoƒüan and Aliyev‚Äôs war of words mean for Armenia?
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of CivilNet‚Äôs weekly Insights series, host Eric Hacopian breaks down the latest war of words between Turkey‚Äôs Recep Tayyip Erdoƒüan and Azerbaijan‚Äôs Ilham Aliyev over the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict and what it may mean for Armenia. He also discusses Armenia‚Äôs performance at this year‚Äôs Summer Olympics in Paris.

entry.title: Purported Spanish journalist who reported on Artsakh war revealed as likely Russian spy

media:group.media:title: Purported Spanish journalist who reported on Artsakh war revealed as likely Russian spy
media:group.media:description:
üìç A purported Spanish journalist who reported from Nagorno-Karabakh (Artsakh) during the 2020 war appears to have been a Russian spy, using his work as cover. üìç American-Armenians weigh the positions of presidential candidates Donald Trump and Kamala Harris on Armenian issues: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/793306/what-would-a-harris-or-trump-presidency-mean-for-armenians/ üìç Mindful Leaders with Sona Tatoyan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AD_OzVMuYNo
